stockmarket.stock

Interface Stock

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    OwnedStock
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractStock, DefaultOwnedStock, DefaultStock

    public interface Stock
    An interface defining the basic structure of a stock object. This object represents a real-world stock traded publicly on a stock exchange.

    Stock objects should not use any public setter methods. Instead, all values should be set via the setStockDetails() method. This method accepts a StockDownloader as a parameter. Downloaders are used to load stock information from a specific source, such as the web, rather than allowing the program to set the stock's values arbitrarily.

    Public getter methods, however, can and should be used. Abstract method getCurrentPrice() is in this interface because the current price of a stock is one of its most important attributes, and access to this value will be needed in nearly every conceivable implementation of this interface.

    The abstract method getValueMap() should be implemented in addition to any getter methods. This is a tool to allow for abstract handling of stock objects, as this method (if properly implemented) can be used to retrieve all the values of the implemented stock, without needing a specific reference to the implementation.

    Lastly, the getStockHistory() method has been provided. This method invokes a corresponding method in the StockDownloader to retrieve a history of the price of this stock over a set period of time.

    NOTE ABOUT DOWNLOADERS: StockDownloader implementations may not support every field name listed as a constant here. When designing a subclass of AbstractStock, be aware of which downloader is likely to be used and which fields are accepted by it. Fields that are not supported by the downloader, but are passed to it as a parameter, will likely throw an exception.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    craig
    See Also:
    StockDownloader

    • Method Detail

      • getSymbol

        java.lang.String getSymbol()
        Get the symbol of this stock.
        Returns:
        the symbol code for this stock.

      • getCurrentPrice

        java.math.BigDecimal getCurrentPrice()
        Gets the current price of a share of the stock. This is they key measurement, more than any other, of a stock's current value.

        This method is to be implemented based on how the downloaded value is stored in the class.

        Returns:
        the current price of a share of the stock.

      • setStockDetails

        void setStockDetails(StockDownloader downloader,
                     boolean fullDetails)
              throws InvalidStockException,
                     java.net.UnknownHostException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Download the details of this stock. The values retrieved should be set as fields in this class.

        The boolean fullDetails parameter should be kept constant with the getValueMap() method of this class. That is to say that when this parameter is false, the same subset of fields is used in both of these methods.

        The list of fields to download passed to the StockDownloader object should be based on constant properties the downloader will recognize. The public fields provided here are mean to fulfill this purpose.

        Parameters:
        downloader - the StockDownloader utility to get this stock's values.
        fullDetails - if true, downloads the values for all the stock's fields. If false, only downloads a limited set of values for a "quick-view".
        Throws:
        InvalidStockException - if this stock is not a valid stock on the New York Stock Exchange.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if a connection cannot be made to the web server to download stock details, most likely due to lack of an internet connection.
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs while trying to download and parse the stock details.
        See Also:
        StockDownloader

      • getStockHistory

        java.util.List<HistoricalQuote> getStockHistory(StockDownloader downloader,
                                                int months)
                                         throws InvalidStockException,
                                                java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                                java.io.IOException
        Download and get a list of HistoricalQuotes defining the recent history of this stock. Useful for long term analysis of trends and the generation of charts.
        Parameters:
        downloader - the StockDownloader utility to get this stock's values from the internet.
        months - the number of months to get a history for.
        Returns:
        a list of HistoricalQuotes for the period requested.
        Throws:
        InvalidStockException - if this stock is not a valid stock on the New York Stock Exchange.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if a connection cannot be made to the web server to download stock details, most likely due to lack of an internet connection.
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs while trying to download and parse the stock details.
        See Also:
        StockDownloader

      • getValueMap

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getValueMap(boolean fullDetails)
        Get a Map of all the values contained in this stock. A boolean parameter is provided so that the full Map doesn't need to be constructed if all that is needed is a smaller subset of data.

        The fullDetails parameter should be kept constant with the setStockDetails() method of this class. That is to say that when this parameter is false, the same subset of fields is used in both of these methods.

        Parameters:
        fullDetails - whether or not the Map should contain all the values of this stock.
        Returns:
        a Map of the values of this stock.
